issue.title: neigh: Install neighbor entries only on devices where routes exist

labels.name: dont-merge/needs-release-note-label
labels.description: The author needs to describe the release impact of these changes.

issue.body:
This PR fixes the issue that neighbor entries can be installed on devices where no route to the destination host exists.

`netlink.RouteGetWithOptions` (equivalent to `ip route get`) with oif returns a route even if the destination is unreachable from the specified interface. The neighbor entries can be installed on all devices because of this.

`netlink.RouteGetWithOptions` with `FIBMatch` option (equivalent to `fibmatch` flag) returns full fib lookup matched route. It returns `No route to host` if the destination is non-routable from the specified device. This PR adds `FIBMatch` option to avoid installing the unnecessary entries.

Note:

- With IPv6, it returns `Network is unreachable` if the destination is unreachable with or without fibmatch.
- With `FIBMatch` option, `netlink.RouteGetWithOptions` returns `MultiPath` field if there are multiple paths to the dest. It returns `GW` field without `FIBMatch`. See examples below.

```
// FIBMatch: false
netlink.Route{ GW: 8.8.8.250, MultiPath: [] }
netlink.Route{ GW: 9.9.9.250, MultiPath: [] }

// FIBMatch: true
netlink.Route{ GW: <nil>, MultiPath: [{Ifindex: 1218 Weight: 1 Gw: 9.9.9.250 Flags: []}, {Ifindex: 1220 Weight: 1 Gw: 8.8.8.250 Flags: []}]}
```

`ip route get` examples

```
$ ip route
10.0.0.0/24 dev veth1 proto kernel scope link src 10.0.0.1
10.0.1.0/24 dev veth3 proto kernel scope link src 10.0.1.1

$ ping -I veth1 10.0.0.1
PING 10.0.0.1 (10.0.0.1) from 10.0.0.1 veth1: 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 10.0.0.1: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.066 ms
64 bytes from 10.0.0.1: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.056 ms
64 bytes from 10.0.0.1: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.057 ms

$ ping -I veth3 10.0.0.1
PING 10.0.0.1 (10.0.0.1) from 10.0.1.1 veth3: 56(84) bytes of data.
From 10.0.1.1 icmp_seq=1 Destination Host Unreachable
From 10.0.1.1 icmp_seq=2 Destination Host Unreachable
From 10.0.1.1 icmp_seq=3 Destination Host Unreachable

$ ip route get 10.0.0.1 oif veth1
local 10.0.0.1 dev lo table local src 10.0.0.1 uid 1000
    cache <local>

// `ip route get` returns a route even if the destination is unreachable
// from the specified interface
$ ip route get 10.0.0.1 oif veth3
10.0.0.1 dev veth3 src 10.0.1.1 uid 1000
    cache

// With fibmatch flag, it returns full fib lookup matched route
$ ip route get fibmatch 10.0.0.1 oif veth1
local 10.0.0.1 dev veth1 proto kernel scope host src 10.0.0.1

$ ip route get fibmatch 10.0.0.1 oif veth3
RTNETLINK answers: No route to host
```

Please ensure your pull request adheres to the following guidelines:

      description and a `Fixes: #XXX` line if the commit addresses a particular
      GitHub issue.
- [x] If your commit description contains a `Fixes: <commit-id>` tag, then
      please add the commit author[s] as reviewer[s] to this issue.
- [x] All commits are signed off. See the section [Developer’s Certificate of Origin](https://docs.cilium.io/en/stable/contributing/development/contributing_guide/#dev-coo)
- [x] Provide a title or release-note blurb suitable for the release notes.
- [x] Are you a user of Cilium? Please add yourself to the [Users doc](https://github.com/cilium/cilium/blob/main/USERS.md)
- [x] Thanks for contributing!

<!-- Description of change -->

Fixes: #28660

In addition, the corresponding config properties have been moved into its own config struct `ingressConfig` where possible.

issue.title: helm: almost always try to delete aws iptables

labels.name: release-note/minor
labels.description: This PR changes functionality that users may find relevant to operating Cilium.

labels.name: needs-backport/1.14
labels.description: This PR / issue needs backporting to the v1.14 branch

issue.body:
Fixes: #25804

This change causes Cilium DaemonSet postStart hook to always delete AWS
iptable rules unless `cni.chainingMode` is set to `aws-cni`.

This will result in the postStart hook being a noop in all non-AWS
deployments. Unfortunately there is no way for helm chart to know
whether it is running on AWS not in ENI mode.

This approach will make sure that we are deleting AWS-specific iptables
rules that cause issues while not requiring us to introduce new
configuration flags for users.

The PR also includes a change in poststart script that makes sure that we delete proper rules.

Credit for figuring out additional scenarios in which we need to delete these rules goes to @squeed and @rabbagliettiandrea


```release-note
helm: delete AWS iptables in all deployments aside from AWS CNI chaining environments 
```

comment.body: All required checks passed, marking as ready to merge

issue.title: Modularization of loader

labels.name: release-note/misc
labels.description: This PR makes changes that have no direct user impact.

issue.body:
This PR is the first in an effort to "clean up" the loader. This work un-exports all internal functions and types and exposes only the externally used functions via the Loader interface. This interface is implemented by a loader struct and is available as cell. This will allow us to make the loader dependent on other functionality and be depended upon, thus going from implicit dependencies to explicit dependencies.

```release-note
Modularization of loader
```

issue.title: bpf: fix ipv6 host firewall logic

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: This is a bug in the Cilium logic.

labels.name: release-note/bug
labels.description: This PR fixes an issue in a previous release of Cilium.

labels.name: area/host-firewall
labels.description: Impacts the host firewall or the host endpoint.

labels.name: feature/ipv6
labels.description: Relates to IPv6 protocol support

labels.name: needs-backport/1.14
labels.description: This PR / issue needs backporting to the v1.14 branch

issue.body:
Relying on MARK_MAGIC_HOST_MASK is not possible when user does not have `--install-iptables-rules=true`. When it's set to false we are not setting `src_id` to its proper value from ipcache which ends up in not creating conntrack OUT entires for traffic originating on the host itself.

This commit unifies the logic across ipv4/ipv6 and fixes the mentioned bug.

Fixes #26886

Me or my colleagues will work on e2e test that will make sure the combination iptables=disabled, hostFW=enabled, masq=disabled, ipv6=enabled works as intended.

cc @julianwiedmann 

related discussion: https://cilium.slack.com/archives/CDKG8NNHK/p1698155364279479

```release-note
bpf: Fix ipv6 host firewall logic when not relying on iptables marks and masquarade disabled.
```

issue.title: bpf: unconditionally migrate tail call maps

labels.name: sig/loader
labels.description: Impacts the loading of BPF programs into the kernel.

labels.name: sig/datapath
labels.description: Impacts bpf/ or low-level forwarding details, including map management and monitor messages.

labels.name: release-note/misc
labels.description: This PR makes changes that have no direct user impact.

issue.body:
This patch makes it so tail call maps (program arrays) are never updated by user space after they've been created + populated.

A new version of an ELF may have some behaviour moved from one tail call to another, potentially leading to unexpected packet drops or a security bypass during the re-population phase of the array.

It is generally not safe from a logical perspective to manipulate a program array that is attached to a live endpoint, since packet processing might take place while the array is being updated.

Fixes: https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/20691

```release-note
Unconditionally migrate tail call maps when Endpoints are updated
```

pull_request.title: Modularization of loader
pull_request.body:
This PR is the first in an effort to "clean up" the loader. This work un-exports all internal functions and types and exposes only the externally used functions via the Loader interface. This interface is implemented by a loader struct and is available as cell. This will allow us to make the loader dependent on other functionality and be depended upon, thus going from implicit dependencies to explicit dependencies.

```release-note
Modularization of loader
```

issue.title: IPv6 packets falsely dropped; conntrack issue

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: This is a bug in the Cilium logic.

labels.name: sig/datapath
labels.description: Impacts bpf/ or low-level forwarding details, including map management and monitor messages.

labels.name: needs/triage
labels.description: This issue requires triaging to establish severity and next steps.

labels.name: kind/community-report
labels.description: This was reported by a user in the Cilium community, eg via Slack.

labels.name: area/host-firewall
labels.description: Impacts the host firewall or the host endpoint.

labels.name: feature/ipv6
labels.description: Relates to IPv6 protocol support

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### What happened?

1. Set up cilium on a dual stack cluster
2. Enable firewall (`CiliumClusterwideNetworkPolicy`) with rules allowing http or ping access to external sources, but no explicit ingress rule
3. Watch dropped packages with the command I provided

On outgoing traffic the identity of the pod is resolved correctly. But on incoming traffic/the response to the outgoing traffic, the packets are dropped because the target identity can not be figured out.
If `::/0` is a explicitly allowed in the firewall, the traffic comes through though.
This seems like a problem with the conntrack table where the lookup of the conntrack table would be done after the traffic is let through, which it isn't because of the firewall setup. Therefore the packets are dropped, despite a conntrack entry existing.
I tried to find a hint in the code, but I am not familiar enough with this code base to give any specific information on that.

### Cilium Version

Client: 1.14.0-snapshot.4 6c8db759 2023-06-16T12:17:20-07:00 go version go1.20.5 linux/amd64
Daemon: 1.14.0-snapshot.4 6c8db759 2023-06-16T12:17:20-07:00 go version go1.20.5 linux/amd64

### Kernel Version

5.15.0-76-generic #83-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jun 15 19:16:32 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Kubernetes Version

Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"27", GitVersion:"v1.27.0", GitCommit:"1b4df30b3cdfeaba6024e81e559a6cd09a089d65", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2023-04-11T17:04:24Z", GoVersion:"go1.20.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

### Sysdump

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
# root@server:/home/cilium# cilium monitor --type drop | grep 2a06:98c1:3120::3
Listening for events on x CPUs with x of shared memory
Press Ctrl-C to quit
level=info msg="Initializing dissection cache..." subsys=monitor
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK
xx drop (Policy denied) flow 0xea08f9f8 to endpoint 0, ifindex 5, file bpf_host.c:379, , identity world->unknown: [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 -> [xx01:xx8:0:axx1::2exx:xxxx]:51824 tcp SYN, ACK

# root@server:/home/cilium# cilium monitor --from 408 
Listening for events on x CPUs with x of shared memory
Press Ctrl-C to quit
level=info msg="Initializing dissection cache..." subsys=monitor
-> stack flow 0xb26c28d7 , identity 3625->world state new ifindex 0 orig-ip 0.0.0.0: [fdxx:ffxx:2xx1:xx::exxe]:59284 -> [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 tcp SYN
-> stack flow 0x31790a5b , identity 3625->world state established ifindex 0 orig-ip 0.0.0.0: [fdxx:ffxx:2xx1:xx::exxe]:59284 -> [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 tcp SYN
-> stack flow 0x571bc5f7 , identity 3625->world state established ifindex 0 orig-ip 0.0.0.0: [fdxx:ffxx:2xx1:xx::exxe]:59284 -> [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 tcp SYN
-> stack flow 0x5a1e7b5f , identity 3625->world state established ifindex 0 orig-ip 0.0.0.0: [fdxx:ffxx:2xx1:xx::exxe]:59284 -> [2a06:98c1:3120::3]:80 tcp SYN
```


### Anything else?

`bpf_host.c:379` from the logs: https://github.com/cilium/cilium/blob/v1.14.0-snapshot.4/bpf/bpf_host.c#L378 I think

### Code of Conduct

comment.body: @oblazek I'm somewhat busy right now, I'll see if I can have a look at this sometime in the afternoon

I initially missed the fact that we are fetching _all_ endpoints' labels each time we run the reconciliation :disappointed:

I don't know if the 1s ratelimit will be enough or not (as this also depends on the number of endpoints in the cluster), I'll have to measure some numbers.

And I guess having a local cache for labels (that gets updated only once per endpoint event in `handleEndpointEvent()`) defeats the purpose of the new `epStore` as the 2 can go out of sync, e.g. we can iterate over an endpoint in `epStore` for which we didn't receive yet the event and so labels are not yet updated?

pull_request.title: egressgw: replace custom endpoint store with `resource.Store[CiliumEndpoint]`
pull_request.body: Use `resource.Store` for `CiliumEndpoints` instead of EGW Manager's custom endpoint cache. This removes some complexity of the custom cache, and resolves potential race conditions, e.g. when events for the same `NamespacedName` (e.g. statfulset pod) come in less common order upon pod restarts.

labels.name: release-note/misc
labels.description: This PR makes changes that have no direct user impact.

issue.title: Improve k8s-get-cilium-pod.sh

labels.name: release-note/misc
labels.description: This PR makes changes that have no direct user impact.

labels.name: kind/community-contribution
labels.description: This was a contribution made by a community member.

issue.body:
Implement several improvements to the script getting a Cilium pod from a target pod name and namespace.

Details:

- Do not rely on field column ordering to get the target pod's node: this can be off easily when, for instance, there are extra fields to indicate a non-zero pod restart count. Instead, use custom columns.
- Improve error handling by checking if the target pod already has a node, and if not bail out.
- Set `errexit` and `pipefail`.
- Use `--no-headers` to avoid having to tail output.
- Use label selectors to discover the Cilium pods.
- Do not hardcode the script's name in the help screen.
- Use proper bash / POSIX syntax.
- Print failure messages to stderr.
- Add explanatory comments.

repo.name: cilium
repo.description: API Aware Networking and Security using BPF and XDP
